txt.en: 'We are so cold at night; how I fear for the young ones! The fools stamp out the fire when I try to light one after dark, and we all shiver the whole night long.\n\n'Our cloaks are too thin, and no fire? We'll not survive this strange winter in this way, but I do not fancy freezing to death in this forsaken place!'

Léofburg complains of cold at night, when the people of Dunfast dare not light a fire for fear of attracting the attention of enemies. Wolf pelts should help to warm these people, and put a stop to their bickering.

'Thank you for these! You are a true friend, unlike my fool neighbours. A fire would save us all, but pelts will do; they will do!'

You gently remind the angry woman of the danger of Núrzum spotting a fire easily in the night. The memory of Núrzum's nearness causes her to whiten.

'You... you are right. I do not wish to run from that creature again.'
Wolves with warm pelts roam the Whitshaws.\n\nYou should kill wolves and skin them for their warm pelts.
Wolves with warm pelts roam the Whitshaws.\n\nYou should kill wolves and skin them for their warm pelts.
Léofburg can be found at the refugee camp in the Whitshaws, south-west of Dunfast.\n\nYou should bring the pelts to Léofburg.

'We are so cold at night; how I fear for the young ones! The fools stamp out the fire when I try to light one after dark, and we all shiver the whole night long.\n\n'Our cloaks are too thin, and no fire? We'll not survive this strange winter in this way, but I do not fancy freezing to death in this forsaken place!'
